p: There were 1197 persons with HIV infection in R16 who tested HIV seropositive in the RCCS for the first time (Fig. 3a). Of these newly detected cases, 162 (14%) were incident HIV infections (i.e. had a prior HIV-negative test at R15) and 350 (29%) were new cohort enrollees who were long-term residents with unknown duration of HIV infection. The remaining 685 (57%) newly detected cases were in-migrants, 70% ( n = 480) of whom were women.
